page.title: 01YEAVELEY VILLAGE
page.content: Yeaveley village is in the middle of Derbyshire. It is quite a small village. There is a pub called The Horse Shoe Inn and a Church. The Post Office and Shop closed down this year. The Primary School will be closing this year too. There are about 80 houses in the village, some of them are Council houses. In the village there is a mushroom farm, a small nursery, an agricultural engineer, a Clay Pigeon Shoot and a small Riding School. There are about 25 farms in and around Yeaveley. Most of the land around the village is pasture land for grazing sheep and dairy cattle or for hay or silage. The land is owned by the local farmers. Yeaveley was mentioned in the original Domesday Survey.
